step: Set the washing machine to a hot, long wash. Push the hot wash button and then select the long wash option.
Add 1 quart (946 mL) of bleach into the machine.
Pause the cycle to allow the bleach to soak in for 1 hour.
Restart the machine to allow the cycle to finish.
task: How to Use Bleach in Your Washing Machine
steps:
```pddl
(:action bring
    :parameters (?agent - entity ?item - object ?target - location)
    :precondition (and (available ?agent) (not (at ?item ?target)))
    :effect (and (at ?item ?target))
)

(:action add
    :parameters (?actor - entity ?target - target ?resource - resource)
    :precondition (and 
        (at ?actor ?target) 
        (not (contains ?target ?resource))
        (valid ?resource)
        (ready_for_addition ?target ?resource)
    )
    :effect (and 
        (contains ?target ?resource)
        (not (empty ?target))
    )
)

(:action run
    :parameters (?entity - object ?resource - resource ?location - place ?state_before - state ?state_after - state)
    :precondition (and (resource ?resource) (entity ?entity) (location ?location) (entity_state ?entity ?state_before))
    :effect (and (entity_state ?entity ?state_after) (resource_location ?resource ?location) (movement ?entity active))
)

(:action clean
    :parameters (?agent - entity ?target - object)
    :precondition (and 
        (not (clean ?target))
        (ready ?agent)
        (dirty ?target)
    )
    :effect (and 
        (clean ?target)
        (not (dirty ?target))
    )
)

(:action dry
    :parameters (?entity - object ?device - drying_device)
    :precondition (and (moisture ?entity wet))
    :effect (and (moisture ?entity dry) (not (moisture ?entity wet)))
)
```

similar_task.task: How to Use Bleach when Doing Your Laundry
step: Fill a bucket or sink with 1 gallon (3.8 L) of hot water.
Mix 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of oxygen or chlorine bleach into the water.
Add your usual washing detergent to treat stained items.
Soak your laundry for up to 1 hour.
Rinse the items under cold water.

step: Set your washer to the highest heat possible.
Add detergent and bleach if your machine has a bleach dispenser.
Add water first if your machine doesn’t have a bleach dispenser.

Add the clothing to the washer.
Allow the washer to run normally.
Finished.

step: Bring all necessary materials to your work area.

Slide the rags or cardboard into the shirt to protect the back from being bleached.
Choose the design that you want to bleach into the shirt.
Apply the design to the shirt.
Pour bleach into a glass container or measuring cup.
Dip a folded-up rag or sponge into the bleach.
Blot the shirt all around the design.
Wait for the bleach to take effect.
Peel the stencil or design off of the shirt.
Remove the rags or cardboard and rinse the shirt in cold water.
Dry the shirt accordingly.

steps:
```pddl
(:action bring
    :parameters (?agent - entity ?item - object ?target - location)
    :precondition (and (available ?agent) (not (at ?item ?target)))
    :effect (and (at ?item ?target))
)

(:action add
    :parameters (?actor - entity ?target - target ?resource - resource)
    :precondition (and 
        (at ?actor ?target) 
        (not (contains ?target ?resource))
        (valid ?resource)
        (ready_for_addition ?target ?resource)
    )
    :effect (and 
        (contains ?target ?resource)
        (not (empty ?target))
    )
)

(:action wait
    :parameters (?entity - entity ?resource - resource)
    :precondition (and (waiting_condition ?entity ?resource))
    :effect (and (condition_met ?entity ?resource))
)

(:action mix
    :parameters (?actor - entity ?target - target ?resource - resource)
    :precondition (and 
        (at ?actor ?target) 
        (contains ?target ?resource)
    )
    :effect (and 
        (mixed ?target ?resource)
    )
)

(:action dissolve
    :parameters (?actor - entity ?item - object ?location - location)
    :precondition (and 
        (at ?actor ?location)
        (contains ?location ?item)
        (mixed ?location ?item)
    )
    :effect (and 
        (dissolved ?item ?location)
    )
)
```
